item.title: 肯尼亚证券交易所所长认为动荡后的反弹将带来更多资金流入
item.description: 肯尼亚证券交易所负责人表示，肯尼亚股票市场从近期政治动荡引发的下跌中反弹后，将吸引更多投资者的兴趣。【原文：Kenya’s equity market is set to attract more interest from investors after rebounding from the fall triggered by recent political upheaval, according to the head of the country’s stock exchange.】

item.title: 欧洲央行 10 月降息势不可挡
item.description: 三周前，欧洲央行官员还认为不太可能降息，现在看来，当他们在 10 月 17 日制定下一个政策时，降息几成定局。【原文：An interest-rate cut that European Central Bank officials deemed unlikely just three weeks ago now seems a near certainty when they next set policy on Oct. 17.】

item.title: 科威特和巴林在燃料贸易方面追随海湾地区较大的邻国
item.description: 科威特和巴林正在建立石油贸易部门，试图利用最近炼油厂的扩建来套现，并效仿该地区一些最大的生产国在买卖燃料方面取得的成功。【原文：Kuwait and Bahrain are setting up oil trading arms as they seek to cash in on recent refinery expansions and emulate the success of some of the region’s biggest producers in buying and selling fuels.】

item.title: 美国银行的门萨表示利率不会回到大流行前的水平
item.description: 美国银行（Bank of America Corp）的伯纳德-门萨（Bernard Mensah）说，由于从地缘政治冲突到供应链变化等各种摩擦困扰着全球经济，世界许多地区的利率可能会持续走高。【原文：Interest rates in many parts of the world will probably stay elevated as frictions ranging from geopolitical conflicts to changes in supply chains plague the global economy, said Bank of America Corp.’s Bernard Mensah said.】

item.title: 韩国锌业与贝恩联手回购高于 MBK 出价的股票
item.description: 韩国锌业公司（Korea Zinc Co.）正在抵御一家私募股权公司主动提出的控制权收购要约，该公司已邀请贝恩资本（Bain Capital）回购这家在首尔上市的公司最多 18% 的流通股。【原文：Korea Zinc Co., which is fending off an unsolicited bid for control from a private equity firm, has roped in Bain Capital to buy back up to 18% outstanding shares of the Seoul-listed company.】

item.title: 达里奥与阿布扎比皇室的 G42 据说将搁置投资合资企业
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，雷-达里奥（Ray Dalio）的家族办公室和谢赫-塔赫农-本-扎耶德-阿勒纳哈扬（Sheikh Tahnoon bin Zayed Al Nahyan）的人工智能公司 G42 已放弃在阿布扎比共同成立一家资产管理企业的计划。【原文：Ray Dalio’s family office and Sheikh Tahnoon bin Zayed Al Nahyan’s artificial intelligence firm G42 have abandoned plans to set up an asset management venture together in Abu Dhabi, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 中东冲突爆发，航空公司挤入沙特领空
item.description: 由于中东冲突不断升级，许多航空公司被封锁了飞越伊朗和伊拉克的航线，因此连接欧洲与中东和南亚的航空公司被迫绕道埃及和沙特阿拉伯领空飞行。【原文：Airlines connecting Europe with the Middle East and South Asia are being forced to fly a more circuitous path using Egyptian and Saudi Arabian airspace as the escalating conflict in the Middle East blocks off routes over Iran and Iraq for many carriers.】

item.title: 股市狂热刺激需求，港元供应趋紧
item.description: 由于本地股反弹和季节性因素，港元供应趋紧，使港元兑美元汇率升至允许的最强水平。【原文：The supply of Hong Kong dollars tightened due to a rally in local shares and seasonal factors, nudging the currency toward the strongest level it’s allowed to trade versus the greenback.】

item.title: 肯尼亚第二季度经济增长放缓至 2022 年低点
item.description: 肯尼亚第二季度的经济增长率降至 18 个月以来的最低点，原因是一系列针对高生活成本的抗议活动拖累了产出和消费支出。【原文：Kenya’s economic growth rate fell to the lowest in 18 months in the second quarter as a series of protests over high living costs weighed on output and consumer spending.】

item.title: 日本顶级银行家预测股票将继续上涨，日本央行将利率维持在 1
item.description: 日本最大银行和经纪公司的高层管理人员预测，日本国内股价将进一步上涨，利率也将进一步上调，他们欢迎一位从金融业起家的新首相。【原文：Top executives of Japan’s biggest banks and brokerages predicted further gains in domestic share prices and more interest-rate hikes, as they welcomed a new prime minister who started his career in the financial sector.】

item.title: 贝莱德在不断增长的印度市场追逐私人信贷交易
item.description: 全球最大的资产管理公司贝莱德公司（BlackRock Inc.【原文：BlackRock Inc., the world’s largest asset manager, is hunting for Indian direct lending opportunities in a broadening array of sectors from agriculture to hospitality as the nation’s booming private credit market lures more borrowers.】

item.title: 中国铁路出行人数创新高，消费前景看好
item.description: 中国铁路网在为期一周的长假首日迎来了创纪录的出行人数，这是世界第二大经济体消费回升的早期迹象。【原文：China’s railway network saw a record number of trips made on the first day of its week-long holiday, offering early signs of a consumer spending pickup in the world’s second-biggest economy.】

item.title: 欧洲央行行长金多斯称欧元区经济复苏将得到加强
item.description: 欧洲中央银行副行长路易斯-德金多斯（Luis de Guindos）表示，尽管危险依然存在，但欧元区的经济复苏势头可能会增强。【原文：The economic revival in the euro area is likely to gain momentum, though dangers remain, according to European Central Bank Vice President Luis de Guindos.】

item.title: BBVA 在萨瓦德尔收购案中增加现金，双方均支付股息
item.description: 在 Banco Sabadell SA 和 BBVA 最近宣布派发股息后，BBVA 调整了收购 Banco Sabadell SA 的报价。【原文：BBVA has adjusted its Banco Sabadell SA takeover offer after both lenders recently announced dividend payments.】

item.title: 以色列誓言对伊朗大规模导弹袭击进行报复
item.description: 伊朗向以色列发射了约 200 枚弹道导弹，本雅明-内塔尼亚胡发誓要对伊朗进行报复。【原文：Benjamin Netanyahu vowed to retaliate against Iran after it fired about 200 ballistic missiles at Israel in a severe escalation of hostilities between the adversaries that world powers fear could spiral into a Middle East-wide war.】

item.title: 肯尼亚议员希望将总统任期延长至七年
item.description: 据《民族日报》刊登的一则公告称，肯尼亚立法者提议修改国家宪法，将总统和议会任期从五年延长至七年。【原文：Kenyan lawmakers proposed revising the nation’s constitution to extend presidential and parliamentary terms to seven years from five, according to a notice published in the Daily Nation newspaper.】

item.title: 泰国交易所新任总裁誓言采取措施恢复投资者信心
item.description: 泰国证券交易所的新任总裁计划优先恢复投资者对泰国资本市场的信心，而投资者的信心因一系列企业丑闻、对非法卖空的担忧以及政治动荡而受到打击。【原文：Thai stock exchange’s new chief plans to prioritize restoring investor confidence in the nation’s capital market that’s been dented by a number of corporate scandals, concerns over illegal short selling and a spell of political turmoil.】

item.title: 南非改革成为吸引投资者的焦点
item.description: 全球最大的投资银行表示，南非需要加快改革步伐，促进经济增长，以维持自联合政府成立以来大量涌入的投资者。【原文：South Africa will need to expedite reforms that can boost economic growth to sustain investor inflows that have flooded in since the formation of a coalition government, according to the world’s largest investment banks.】

item.title: 由 Adnoc 投资的 VTTI 希望收购亚洲的液化天然气接收站
item.description: 由阿布扎比主要石油公司和维托尔集团（Vitol Group）支持的储能公司 VTTI BV 正寻求在亚洲投资液化天然气进口终端，因为该地区对这种燃料的需求正在增加。【原文：Energy storage company VTTI BV, backed by Abu Dhabi’s main oil company and Vitol Group, is looking to invest in LNG import terminals in Asia as demand for the fuel increases in the region.】

item.title: 莫比乌斯资本买入越南股票，看好越南经济升级和增长前景
item.description: Mobius Capital Partners LLP 已经增持了越南股票，因为预期越南市场将被升级为新兴市场。【原文：Mobius Capital Partners LLP has raised its holdings of Vietnamese stocks on expectations that the market will be upgraded to emerging-market status.】

item.title: 据说 KKR 正在考虑收购芯片齿轮制造商 ASMPT
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士透露，KKR & Co.公司正在考虑收购价值约 50 亿美元的半导体和电子设备制造商 ASMPT Ltd.，此举是继其他竞购者之前的收购尝试之后的又一举措。【原文：KKR & Co. is considering a takeover bid for the roughly $5 billion semiconductor and electronics equipment maker ASMPT Ltd., people familiar with the matter said, a move that would follow previous acquisition attempts from other bidders.】

item.title: 野村首席执行官在调查债券市场操纵行为后道歉
item.description: 野村控股公司（Nomura Holdings Inc.首席执行官奥田健太郎（Kentaro Okuda）在被指控一名员工操纵债券期货市场后首次公开露面道歉。【原文：Nomura Holdings Inc. Chief Executive Officer Kentaro Okuda apologized in his first public appearance following allegations that an employee manipulated the bond futures market.】

item.title: 西班牙成为投资者的最爱，银行和 Inditex 推动 Ibex 指数反弹
item.description: 西班牙资产已成为投资者的最爱，这无疑表明该国终于摆脱了十多年前主权债务危机的创伤。【原文：Spanish assets have become investor favorites, a sure sign that the country has finally moved on from the trauma of its sovereign debt crisis more than a decade ago.】

item.title: 澳新银行首席执行官埃利奥特称对中国的担忧 "被严重夸大了
item.description: 澳新银行集团控股有限公司（ANZ Group Holdings Ltd.澳新银行首席执行官谢恩-埃利奥特（Shayne Elliott）表示，对中国作为投资目的地 "消亡 "的担忧 "被严重夸大了"，该银行在中国的业务十分活跃。【原文：ANZ Group Holdings Ltd. Chief Executive Officer Shayne Elliott said fears about the “demise of China” as an investment destination are “massively overblown,” with the bank seeing brisk business in the country.】

item.title: 肯尼亚 9 月食品价格上涨，通胀率降至 12 年低点
item.description: 在食品和能源价格增长放缓的帮助下，肯尼亚 9 月份的年度通胀率降至近 12 年来最慢。【原文：Kenya’s annual inflation eased in September to the slowest pace in almost 12 years, helped by weaker growth in food and energy prices.】

item.title: 毛里求斯卢比创下 13 年来的最佳季度业绩，旅游业将为其提供动力
item.description: 据牛津经济非洲公司（Oxford Economics Africa）称，随着这个印度洋岛国夏季旅游收入的增长，毛里求斯卢比将在十多年来最强劲季度的基础上再接再厉。【原文：Mauritius’s rupee is set to build on its strongest quarter in more than a decade as tourism receipts in the Indian Ocean island nation’s summer months increase, according to Oxford Economics Africa.】
